---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9265109082/job/25486483366)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9265109082/job/25486482894)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9265109082/job/25486483107)
Please keep the original direction for the deprecated version
Oh, I see what you mean. I had assumed `Int.gcd` what `Int`-valued

```suggestion
theorem intCast_dvd_intCast [CommRing Î±] (m n : â„¤) (h : m âˆ£ n) : (m : Î±) âˆ£ (n : Î±) :=
```
for coherence?
It's in namespace `Int` unless I've messed up.
Indeed, I just checked and it is in namespace `Int`

Does the naming convention specify the order of words here, i.e., `natCast_strictMono` or `strictMono_natCast` (where the latter follows more closely the order of symbols in the statement)? Greping mathlib, I found several examples in both directions.
`injective`, `mono`, `strictMono` go to the end. Most other predicates go to the front.

I could not find comments about this in https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html. Could you maybe update this page (and try to explain the convention, which looks pretty arbitrary to me)?
I will do that, but can we not hold up this PR on it? It's completely orthogonal.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: Rename more `coe_nat`/`coe_int` to `natCast`/`intCast`
